data.Title: Portable Eurorack Compatible Synthesizer with Voice Cards
data.Desc: A portable, battery powered synthesizer featuring a voltage controlled amplifier, band-pass voltage controlled filter (independent cutoff frequency) with resonance, voltage controlled amplifier, and voltage controlled ADSR envelope generator. The device is comprised of one or more stackable voice cards, backplane PCB with input potentiometers and switches, and a modular lithium cell power supply with USB-PD charging and ±12V and ±5V output rails. The input PCB also features a microcontroller which communicates with each voice card to allow polyphony.
data.Keywords: electronics, programming, coding, code, program, electronic, PCB, printed, circuit, board, schematic, portable, battery, eurorack, CV, filter, high, low, pass, high-pass, low-pass, amplifier, ADSR, envelope, generator, VCO, VCA, VCF, oscillator, amplifier, filter, keyboard, microcontroller, mcu, embedded

data.Title: Low Cost Electronic Braille Display Module
data.Desc: A low cost design for an electronic braille display module. The module uses latching solenoids actuated with H-bridge drivers, incorporating a low cost embedded microcontroller to communicate over SPI, I²C or USART as a standby/sub device.

data.Title: TensorFlow Face Autoencoder
data.Desc: An autoencoder TensorFlow model trained to recreate faces by compressing images into a latent space and then decompressing them to recover the original image. An input in the latent space can then be decoded to create faces not in the dataset. Trained on the NIST Celeb A dataset.
data.Keywords: programming, coding, code, program, python, AI, machine learning, neural network, auto encoder, auto-encoder, back propagation, tensorflow, tensor flow, TF, object-oriented, object oriented, face, latent space, image, images, NIST

data.Title: A* Maze Solver
data.Desc: A maze solver written in C#, using the A* pathfinding algorithm. Takes a PNG file as input and outputs a PNG file with the path solving the maze.

data.Desc: Range sliders made from div elements with very little JavaScript, and no external libraries required. Useful for selection within a range of values, and styles can be modified to suit a theme or style.

data.Title: N-body Simulation
data.Desc: N-Body simulation using OpenGL and OpenCL to accelerate computation using GPUs. Uses the Barnes-Hut quadtree optimization algorithm, and Verlet integration method.

data.Title: High Current Multi-Phase Buck Converter
data.Desc: Senior design project 2022-23. Design and fabrication of a high current, low-cost, multi-phase buck converter with variable input voltage ranging from 5-12V and a fixed output of 1V, supporting an output current of 75A, and with efficiency of 90%
data.Keywords: voltage, buck, converter, current, multi, phase, multi-phase, multiphase, dc-dc, dcdc, dc dc, drop, efficient, efficiency, low, high, school, college, education, nonisolated, non-isolated

data.Title: Back Propagation Feed Forward Neural Network
data.Desc: A feed-forward neural network trained using back propagation. Written in C#, and run on the CPU. The example shows the network trained to identify which 2x2 image is displayed (dot in a corner, diagonal, vertical or horizonal lines). Though the example does not use a separate verification set due to the small network size and simplicity, one could run a separate verification step.
data.Keywords: programming, coding, code, program, python, AI, machine learning, neural network, back propagation, object-oriented, object oriented, c-sharp, c sharp, csharp, c#, neuron, model, train, identify, image, perceptron, layer, epoch

data.Title: Discord Python Bot for Scraping Reddit Posts
data.Desc: A Discord bot written using Discord.py and asyncpraw to scrape the newest posts from a subreddit, and send the appropriate posts to a discord channel for notifications. The discord channel also allows for adding, removing, viewing, subscribing and unsubscribing keywords which are searched for in the post's title and body.
